verb: a content word that denotes an action, occurrence, or state of existence
version: a specific form or variation of something
very: to a great extent or degree
vessel: a tube in which a body fluid circulates
veteran: a serviceman who has seen considerable active service
viable: capable of being done with means at hand and circumstances as they are
victory: a successful ending of a struggle or contest
video: the visible part of a television transmission
view: the visual percept of a region
village: a settlement smaller than a town
vintage: a season's yield of wine from a vineyard
violin: bowed stringed instrument that is the highest member of the violin family; this instrument has four strings and a hollow body and an unfretted fingerboard and is played with a bow
virtual: existing in essence or effect though not in actual fact
virus: (virology) ultramicroscopic infectious agent that replicates itself only within cells of living hosts; many are pathogenic; a piece of nucleic acid (DNA or RNA) wrapped in a thin coat of protein
visa: an endorsement made in a passport that allows the bearer to enter the country issuing it
visit: the act of going to see some person or place or thing for a short time
visual: any element of something that depends on sight
vivid: having the clarity and freshness of immediate experience
vocal: of or pertaining to the voice or speech
voice: the distinctive quality or pitch or condition of a person's speech
volcano: a fissure in the earth's crust (or in the surface of some other planet) through which molten lava and gases erupt
volume: a three-dimensional measure of space that comprises a length, a width and a height
vote: a formalized choice that is made by counting the number of people in favor of each alternative
voyage: a long journey, especially by ship
wage: an amount of money paid to a worker for a specified quantity of work, usually calculated on an hourly basis and expressed in an amount of money per hour
wagon: a four-wheeled cart for hauling loads
wait: to delay movement or action until some event or time; to remain neglected or in readiness
walk: use one's feet to advance; advance by steps
wall: an architectural partition with a height and length greater than its thickness; used to divide or enclose an area or to support another structure
walnut: nut of a walnut tree having a wrinkled two-lobed seed with a hard shell
want: wish or demand the presence of
warfare: the waging of armed conflict against an enemy
warm: having a temperature slightly higher than usual, but still pleasant; mildly hot
warrior: someone engaged in or experienced in warfare
wasp: any of many types of stinging flying insect resembling a hornet
waste: any materials unused and rejected as worthless or unwanted
water: binary compound that occurs at room temperature as a clear colorless odorless tasteless liquid; freezes into ice below 0 degrees centigrade and boils above 100 degrees centigrade; widely used as a solvent
wave: one of a series of ridges that moves across the surface of a liquid (especially across a large body of water)
way: any artifact consisting of a road or path affording passage from one place to another
wealth: the state of being rich and affluent; having a plentiful supply of material goods and money
weapon: any instrument used in fighting or hunting
weasel: small carnivorous mammal with short legs and elongated body and neck
weather: the atmospheric conditions that comprise the state of the atmosphere in terms of temperature and wind and clouds and precipitation
web: the silken structure which a spider builds using silk secreted from the spinnerets at the caudal tip of its abdomen; a spiderweb
wedding: the social event at which the ceremony of marriage is performed
weekend: a time period usually extending from Friday night through Sunday; more loosely defined as any period of successive days including one and only one Sunday
west: the cardinal compass point that is a 270 degrees
wet: made up of liquid or moisture, usually (but not always) water
whale: any of the larger cetacean mammals having a streamlined body and breathing through a blowhole on the head
what: (interrogative) which thing, event, circumstance, etc.: used interrogatively in asking for the specification of an identity, quantity, quality, etc.
wheat: annual or biennial grass having erect flower spikes and light brown grains
wheel: a simple machine consisting of a circular frame with spokes (or a solid disc) that can rotate on a shaft or axle (as in vehicles or other machines)
when: (interrogative) used to introduce questions about time
where: (interrogative) at what place; to what place; what place
whip: an instrument with a handle and a flexible lash that is used for striking
whisper: speaking softly without vibration of the vocal cords
wide: having great (or a certain) extent from one side to the other
width: the extent of something from side to side
wife: a married woman; a man's partner in marriage
wild: in a natural state; not tamed or domesticated or cultivated
will: the capability of conscious choice and decision and intention
win: be the winner in a contest or competition; be victorious
window: a framework of wood or metal that contains a glass windowpane and is built into a wall or roof to admit light or air
wing: a movable organ for flying (one of a pair)
wink: an act of winking (a blinking of only one eye), or a message sent by winking
winner: the contestant who wins the contest
winter: the coldest season of the year; in the northern hemisphere it extends from the winter solstice to the vernal equinox
wire: metal formed into a thin, even thread
wisdom: accumulated knowledge or erudition or enlightenment
wise: having or prompted by wisdom or discernment
wish: a desire, hope, or longing for something or for something to happen, usually unrelated to ones actions
witness: someone who sees an event and reports what happened
wolf: any of various predatory carnivorous canine mammals of Eurasia and North America that usually hunt in packs
wonder: the feeling aroused by something strange and surprising
wood: the hard fibrous lignified substance under the bark of trees
wool: a fabric made from the hair of sheep
word: a unit of language that native speakers can identify
work: activity directed toward making or doing something
world: human collective existence; existence in general
worth: the quality that renders something desirable or valuable or useful
wrap: arrange or fold as a cover or protection
wreck: the remains of something that has been severely damaged or worn down
wrestle: to contend, with an opponent, by grappling and attempting to throw, immobilize or otherwise defeat him, depending on the specific rules of the contest
wrist: the joint between the arm and the hand
write: then act or style of writing
wrong: that which is incorrect or contrary to the principles of justice or law
yard: the enclosed land around a house or other building
year: a period of time containing 365 (or 366) days
yellow: yellow color or pigment; the chromatic color resembling the hue of sunflowers or ripe lemons
you: the individual or group spoken or written to
young: in the early part of growth or life; born not long ago
zebra: an animal that somewhat looks like a horse, but has black and white stripes
zero: zero is a count of nothing, often written as 0
zone: a zone is an area that is known for a particular use
zoo: the facility where wild animals are housed for exhibition
